Entry.1:
Left Heliopollis for Alex 5/8/15 entrained at 10.30 pm with left 1/2 Battn.

Monday: -
Entry.3:
Inf with us. promoted Major - Left Alex at 4 pm

Tuesday: - Met

Wednesday -
Entry.4:
a small concert and a flirtation of a mild nature. arrived at Lemnos .

Thursday 19/8/15 Transferred to Transport "El " for Anzac Cove arriving at midnight.

Friday : - 20/8/15 Landed at Reserve Gully Beach 1st experience of shrapnel Ship hit at 9.30 pm 2 Battns ordered out north to act as Reserve to force operating against Hill 971 arrived 10 pm during evening

3 men wounded Martin 'A' Coy dangerously.

Saturday 21/8/15 Order to move Battn in rear of right of line held by 4th Bde to act as a special Reserve Reconnoitre ground with Brig. & Major Martin, later at new position with Biers & Maughan. Took Two platoons up as support to 13th Battn (Tilney) Bas and McBride in charge. had look at Fire positions returned to Battn after midnight - Big attack -

Sunday 22/8/15 Two platoons returned about 12 noon - Bas having taken picks & shovels over to 18th McPherson, Bamfield, Donaldson



killed - 130 men Killed & wounded
Left in charge of 1½ coys to relieve part of
Entry.5: Battn at 8.30 pm men all on duty 11 pm
Entry.7: Visited whole of position & had troops clearing. Brigadier has been made a B/General (congratulations) One man shot (wounded through loophole McEnally ? Saw Martin & got Machine Gun on No 1 Post
Entry.9:
Remainder of "D" Coy rejoined with Hdqrs of Battn which will eventually relieve 16th. One man Gordon wounded in hand Visited Kings Own Pos.

on my right. buried 3 dead Turks.
Entry.11:
In telephonic com with Hdqrs - visited Kings Own on right front. Went for swim with Bas but had to abandon swim owing to Bas being wounded by Shrapnel in head. Two men Donovan (Badly) and Godfrey wounded by snipers. some wild firing stopped. one wounded by himself in foot (Williams)

Thursday
Entry.12:
All quiet along front. Turks digging hard - it is thought sniper has been acounted for.

Friday
Entry.13:
Attack of enemy pos by troops on left flank

part of 17th Bn engaged - Coy sustaining Fire & movement on immediate Front. One Machine Gunner Killed.
Entry.14: Wounded in both legs by sniper sent through 5th Field Amb to Clearing and later to Hospital Ship "Devonah" Saw General Holmes before leaving.
Entry.15:
Feel a bit brighter ship doesnt leave until early tomorrow - Just heard Doddy Lane killed.

Monday
Entry.16:
Believe we have arrived at Embros read a couple of novels & wrote to Doff but haven't posted

it. Hear we are off to Malta.
Entry.17: M.O. operated on my left thigh and got a bullet out - hurt a bit but am feeling better now, left For Malta at 7 pm.
Entry.18:
Getting on well saw a bit of Greece through port Hole.

Thursday
Entry.19: finished letters to Doff & others Arrived Malta 4 30 pm anchored outside
Entry.20:
Took up anchorage at Malta - Ship coaling

Reserve Gully Looking South 20/8/15

Saturday
Entry.21:
Wounded a week today - proceeeded to land certain Bas came on board he returns tomorrow he is sending cable to Doff Left Malta at 6 pm for England.

Sunday
Entry.22:
Quiet day - mail for NSW closes 1.30 pm tomorrow

Monday
Entry.25: arrived Gib daybreak left 9 am for Southampton - Spent a saw Spain
Entry.26:
Spent day on deck had good views of Spain & Portugal should arrive England Sunday.

Friday
Entry.27:
Cold day did not go on deck - wrote letter to Doff.

Saturday
Entry.28:
Fortnight today since wounded and one year ago since landing at KabaKaul & Wireless Station at Bitapaka - went on deck very cold passed Cape Ushant

Sunday
Entry.29:
Arrived Southampton & sent straight off by train to 3rd London General Hospital - Royal Victoria P Schools - Wandsworth - will arrange cable Doff tomorrow

Monday
Entry.30: Cabled Doff - Had a hot bath in afternoon feeling rather down. Zep.Raid at night overLondon - Hospital in darkness
Entry.31:
Sat up in chair for 2 or 3 hours had a visit from Lady Newnes & Mrs Buckley & an invitation to stay at country house.

Wednesday
Entry.32:
Had a very quiet day in bed felt a bit weary

Thursday
Entry.33:
Examined by Ear specialist have to undergo operation went for drive in Car through London - And a cable from Doff which has cheered me up very much.

Friday
Entry.34: Felt pretty tired had a quiet day Sent cable to Doff.
Entry.35: Went out in Garden & afterwards to concert in Main Hall - very Good.
Entry.36:
Trip in car (Mr Taplin) toHenley - a beautiful drive and a very pleasant day right through.

Monday
Entry.37:
Quiet day - wrote to Doff & the General.

Tuesday
Entry.38: Went for a run in car through Richmond Park - Right leg very sore
Entry.39:
Feel better - but had a quiet day - had a visit from a Miss Hawker very nice too -



Thursday
Entry.40:
Went for run through London legs a little better - Wrote to Doff

Friday
Entry.41:
Quiet day generallyvisited by American ladies.

Saturday
Entry.42:
wounded four weeks today, left leg getting along splendidly - Right leg a little bit sore yet.

Sunday
Entry.43:
Quiet day spent legs on the mend.

Monday
Entry.44:
Quiet day had a go on crutches but didn't do too well

Tuesday
Entry.45:
Quiet day - went to a concert in the Hall - very good one - Measured for uniform.

wrote to Doff & the General 

Wednesday
Entry.46:
Went for run to Hampton Court in car - returned in time to see the Slys.

Thursday
Entry.47:
Went into the tailors & sent cable off to Doff - wrote
 letter
 to Doff.
Entry.49:
Went for a run with Lady Newnes in car to Crystal Palace & afterwards to tea at her house (Girl danced)

Saturday
Entry.50:
Went to see "Scarlet Pimpernel" had dinner at "Rendezvous" home 9 pm. new uniform ready.

Sunday
Entry.51:
Quiet day - started on course of massage for right leg.

Monday
Entry.52:
Went to Tea party at Wandsworth & afterwards had dinner with Mackay at the Trocodero.

Tuesday
Entry.53:
Visited Westminster Abbey - & St Pauls - had tea with Miss Weigall Wrote to Doff

Wednesday
Entry.54:
Went to see "Push & Go" Revue at the Hippodrome

Thursday
Entry.55: Went to Hawkes for uniform had a good walk without crutches
Entry.56:
Went to Tea and then stayed for dinner at Wellbeck Inn with an American Lady Mrs Carney.

Saturday
Entry.57:
Went to an afternoon tea party at Wandsworth. wounded 6 weeks.

Sunday
Entry.58:
Had a quiet time at home (hospital)

Monday
Entry.59:
Had afternoon tea at "Rumpelmayer" with Lt Higgins & his sister. Went to picture show and then to "Shell Out" very good
6 weeks leave

Tuesday
Entry.60:
Had lunch at Maxims drew£15 - went to Hampstead Heath with Lady Newnes - went to Dr Partridge to dinner

Wednesday
Entry.61:
Went into Maxims to lunch and then 



to the matinee Bric-a-Brac had dinner at Piccadilly Saw a Zeppelin Raid married 14 months today

Thursday
Entry.62:
Went to afternon tea at Rumpelmayer then dinner & Maxims and then Coliseum

Friday
Entry.63:
Left Hospital and came to stay at Col Buckley's Digswell Place Welwyn.

Saturday
Entry.64:
Went into Harford to see effects of the Zep Bombs (having previously written Doff I also cabled her) Had a go at pheasants in the afternoon

Sunday
Entry.65:
Went to Digswell House in afternoon - quiet day

Monday
Entry.66:
Cut down tree for exercise - went by car to Hitchen.

Tuesday
Entry.67:
Sawing wood - run in car with Blacket & his Sister - visited electric massage gymnasium

Wednesday
Entry.68:
Wrote to Doff & sent some English Holly - Gardening

Thursday
Entry.69:
Wrote again to Doff more gardening.

Friday
Entry.70:
Went with Mrs Buckley to London to the Caledonian Markets.

(Thieves Mkt) bought some things for Doff - had lunch with Mrs B senior then went out to Hospital at Wandsworth

Saturday
Entry.71: Went for long walk with Rosemary Buckley
Entry.72:
Wet day 
all 
went for a walk and read all day

Monday
Entry.73:
Gardening in morning wrote to Doff & Mother

Tuesday
Entry.74:
Went for run in car with Dr Thomas to different Houses.

Wednesday
Entry.75:
Spent day in London with Corlette - Had a nice Long letter from Doff also one from Florrie.

Thursday
Entry.76:
Raining heavily. wrote letter to Doff

Friday
Entry.77:
Had letter from Doff forward from Egypt walked to Hatfield (7 miles)

Saturday
Entry.78: Had letter from Corlette - went to St Albans and saw oldest inhabited house in England - "The Fighting Cocks" & the Cathedral at St Albans
Entry.79:
Woke in a most unusual manner at 2 am and noted time which would be 12 noon 31/10/15 - I think it was on account of Doff. Raining all day

Monday
Entry.80:
Went to London - had lunch with Mrs Herring at S. Kensington Went to Harrods and bought some Xmas presents for Doff which I have given to Dave Storey to take back to Australia he leaves on Friday. Returned to Welwyn at 10.45 pm Had a letter from Doff via America.

Tuesday
Entry.81:
Left Welwyn for Mr Wills at Clevedon Somerset and arrived at 7 pm.

Wednesday
Entry.82:
Went for a drive around Clevedon and in the afternoon down to the Beach - British Channel

Thursday
Entry.83:
Wrote to Doff - Went to Bristol and in the afternoon to "Betty" a very pretty play

Friday
Entry.84:
Easy day - had letter from Doff & am very anxious about her and cabled

Saturday
Entry.85:
Left for London at 10.30 arrived at 2 pm. travelled last 118 miles in 2 hours arived at Dunn's at



Goodmayes at 6 pm went to Revue at Ilford at night

Sunday
Entry.86:
Very quiet Day nothing doing at all

Monday
Entry.87: Went to London, met Pye and knocked around with him. wrote Doff.
Entry.88:
Left Goodmayes for good - saw Lord Mayors Procession returned to Welwyn

Weednesday 10/11/15 Left Welwyn for London - Had a cable saying Fine son Born Yesterday Tuesday 9th both well - very pleased

sent a cable to Doff - Stayed the night with the Coutts Micki 184 Queens Gate London.
Entry.90: Left London at 1.40 pm. for the Duke of Newcastles place Clumber Worksop Notts - arriving at 6 pm. - Had letter from Doff
Entry.91: very bad cold - raining heavily all day - had a game of Billiards.
Entry.92:
Went shooting with Corlette - Bag consisted of 12 pheasants 1 duck 1 rabbit, and 1 fallow Deer. Wrote to Doff

Sunday
Entry.93:
went to church at Clumber - very high church service In afternoon went with Duchess to her kennels & the farm

Monday
Entry.94:
Went shooting - Bag 5 hares & 5 partridges came home in the snow - very cold

Tuesday
Entry.95:
Snowing all night. Went for a long walk and in the afternoon visited Robin Hood's Larder (Oak) and the Queen or Major Oak a beautiful big tree on Lord Malvers property Thorsby (Park). Wrote to Doff

Wednesday
Entry.96:
Went shooting Bag consisted of 16 pheasants & 2 sent some feathers to Doff

Thursday
Entry.97:
Went shooting in morning at Duck - no luck

Friday
Entry.98:
Cancelled trip to Scotland, sent photos to Doff - Went to kennels & farm with Duchess

Saturday
Entry.99:
Left Clumber for London - Went to a Picture show - staying at 184 Queens Gate

Sunday
Entry.100:
Went to Wandsworth Hospital. Had tea with Roberta Dight



friend of Lindeman's

Monday
Entry.101:
Had lunch at "Ye Old Chessire Cheese" Walked over Tower Bridge - Saw slums of London by night with a Detective Sergeant

Tuesday
Entry.102:
Had a board & passed as fit for service. Wrote Doff

Wednesday
Entry.103: Visited Guildhall and Cheapside London went to a "Cinema"
Entry.104:
Wrote to Doff sending some photos taken by Corlette - Had a large mail and 4 long letters from Doff - Went to see "A Little bit of Fluff"

Friday
Entry.105:
Reported for duty at Bostall Camp Abbey Wood.

Saturday
Entry.106:
Went on Parade and took over 400 Afternoon walked to Woolwich.

Sunday
Entry.107:
Church Parade at Woolwich - Took charge of "March Past" Wrote to Doff.

Monday
Entry.110: Funeral of man killed by motor car
Entry.111:
Raining all day. wrote

to Doff

Thursday
Entry.112:
Physical Drill and Coy Drill wrote to Doff.

Friday
Entry.113:
Raining heavily went into London stayed at Cannons Hotel went to Coliseum at night

Saturday
Entry.114:
Sent cable to Doff left for Hazlemere (Coutts - Micki) with Corlette.

Sunday
Entry.115:
Went by car to Aldershot - very cold - played billiards

Monday
Entry.116:
Bought Doff a scarf at Libertys - returned to Camp - wrote to Doff.

Tuesday
Entry.117:
making new arrangements for Class A (fit) men at Camp.

Wednesday
Entry.118:
Had letter from Doff - Concert in Camp in Evening Dr Walford Davies

Thursday
Entry.119:
Cable from Doff saying she and Billie had lunched at Farmers Bought pair of top boots went to Tonights the Night

Friday
Entry.120:
Returned to Camp Had letter from Doff Raining. Cable to Doff

Saturday
Entry.121:
Quiet day - forenoon parade

afternoonfootball

Sunday
Entry.122: Church parade snowing - very cold - wrote to Doff
Entry.123:
Very cold Parades - Lecture by Mjr Clogston R.E.

Tuesday
Entry.124: Cold & raining Messing arrangements Concert party.
Entry.125:
Raining - Boxing match - very good

Thursday
Entry.126:
Went to concert in aid of Red Cross very good - wrote to Doff

Friday
Entry.127: Quiet day - cable to Doff wishing a Merry Xmas & Happy New Year
Entry.128: Had a game of football on winning side - two sore knees.
Entry.129:
Stayed in bed all day - very stiff & sore

Monday
Entry.130:
Parades as usual News received of withdrawal from Anzac

Tuesday 21/12/15 Went into London re Draft am now in charge 3rd Draft Met Jack R Jones & went to Alhambra stayed in London at same pub
Entry.132: Returned to camp Nothing doing. Hogan sick
Entry.133:
23/121/15 Granting of Xmas leave - letter & present from Duchess of Newcastle

Friday
Entry.134:
Hogan to Hospital - now in charge of Depot cable received from Doff

Saturday
Entry.135:
Xmas Day - visited each mess in camp and saw men all looked after - slow time and unhappy played Billiards most of the Day

Sunday
Entry.136:
Wrote to Doff very quiet Day

Monday
Entry.138:
Instructed to send draft of 100 tomorrow not included myself

Wednesday
Entry.139: Draft left things quiet generally feeling off color - letter from Doff run thro' Kent.
Entry.140:
Very sick indeed remained in bed all day

Friday
Entry.141:
A little better today still in bed Wrote to Doff Got up in evening & went to see New Year in at R.A.Mess Woolwich

1916

Saturday
Entry.142:
Raining Heavily No parade - Capt Collins visit

Sunday
Entry.143:
Visited Hogan at Hosp. Man Wilson died suddenly Went for long walk

Monday
Entry.144:
General shake up of men in camp - Muster parade tomorrow Wrote to Doff and Basil

Tuesday
Entry.145:
Muster parade - huge success spoke very plainly to the men

Wednesday
Entry.146:
New arrangements re parades made by Orderly Room no leave granted

Thursday
Entry.147:
New Draft ready all men before Orderly Room

Friday
Entry.148:
Draft left - Orderly Room - Concert by Mr Grey.

Saturday
Entry.149: Parades all Day no week end leave
Entry.150: Went to London lunch at Piccadilly visited the Slys
Entry.151:
Went to London saw Moore who practically has told me I am to remain in charge Abbey Wood - coming home Motor Accident not hurt

Tuesday
Entry.152:
Parades as usual Concert at night (Pierrot) no good.

Wednesday
Entry.153:
Mr Gray dinner re furnishing mess - had dinner R A Mess & went to theatre

Thursday
Entry.154:
Mrs Gray came re furnishing mess wrote to Doff

Friday
Entry.155:
Sent cable to General asking him to cable for my return
takings of canteen for Decr £290

Saturday
Entry.156:
Wrote to Doff and the General 

Sunday
Entry.157:
Went to afternoon tea & supper to the Spencers at Blackheath.

Monday
Entry.158:
Arrangements re Sports - Wrote to Doff.

Tuesday
Entry.159:
Went to London re Base appointment saw Col Buckley & asked to be returned saw S.O. to Moore.

Wednesday
Entry.160: Arrangements for Officers Mess and Sports on Wednesday 26th.
Entry.161:
Mess arrangements Fatigues etc in Camp general clean up.

Friday 21/1/16 Jackson Adj gone as S.O. to Moore informs me I am to be kept as 2nd in command at Weymouth. General work around camp.
Entry.163:
Went to Catford by taxi - Saw Moore & Jackson - Concert Party in Evening - a merry Evening - Hogan throwing things about.

Sunday
Entry.164:
Church Service - P.M. went to Joe Marsh the Horse Dentist at Hampton Court. Stayed Evening at Horrocks Hotel.

Monday
Entry.165:
Returned Camp 10 am arangements re Sports at Camp on 26/1/16

wrote to Doff - Played first round of the snooker tournament won.

Tuesday
Entry.166:
Final arrangements for Sports. Everything going well.

Wednesday
Entry.167: Australia Day Sports throughout a great success - Played football again Welsh Guards Concert at night
Entry.168:
Call from General Holmes asking me to return at once - Saw Moore & have been included in Draft Dinner at Piccadilly Went to Honi Soit

Friday 28/1/16 Very Sore & Stiff Draft leaves on

Tuesday next 1/2/16.
Entry.170:
Went to London - had lunch at Hatchetts with Corlett - cabled Doff and Bas - Madam Troussards - Dinner at Princes Restaurant Wrote to Doff

Sunday
Entry.171:
Instructions received to report at Weymouth left at 1 pm and arrived at W at 7 pm.

Monday
Entry.172:
All arrangements for Departure made innoc. against enteric.

Tuesday
Entry.173:
Left Weymouth 6.30 am embarked on HMT Saturnia at Plymouth at 3 pm Ship leaves tomorrow

Wednesday
Entry.174: Left Plymouth at 10 AM escorted by two Destroyers
Entry.175:
Sailing well toward west - very heavy sea lot of men sea sick

Friday
Entry.176:
Sea still very rough not feeling too good but havn't missed a meal

Saturday
Entry.177:
weather much better vessel running to smooth water - concert

Sunday
Entry.178:
beautiful weather passed the Gib at 10 pm

Monday
Entry.179:
Beautiful weather saw Spain under snow

Tuesday
Entry.180:
Weather still glorious saw Africa under snow

Wednesday
Entry.181:
Passed French Patrol boat weather delightful

Thursday
Entry.182:
Passsed 3 Patrol Boats in distance - Rather funny wedding on board - Storm brewing

Friday
Entry.183:
Very rough a lot of men sick

Saturday
Entry.184:
Weather calmer Concert in afternoon Passed liner both of us zig zagging. Wrote to Doff.

Sunday
Entry.185:
Arrived Alexandria disembarked at 4 pm arrived Cairo 9.15 pm saw Gen Irving & arranged to report to 5th Bde



Monday
Entry.186:
Cabled Doff - Fixed up luggage - wrote to Doff arrived Ismalia 10.15 slept at Hospital

Tuesday 15/2/16 Reported at Anzac Hdqrs proceeded to Ferry Post saw John Paton Reported at 2nd Div, Hdqrs. had lunch reported to 5th Bde Hdqrs Brig. looking well stayed night at Brigade saw Bas
Entry.188:
Reported at 17th Bn at Gundagai Post had a good look around

Thursday
Entry.189:
Acting 2nd in Command have taken over Training of Unit. Visited Outposts

Friday
Entry.190:
N.C.O's taken in hand saw 'C' Coy at work Visited Outposts.

Saturday
Entry.191:
Address to Battalion by Gen Legge Div. Cmdr on conduct of Australians re-adjusted outposts

Sunday
Entry.192:
Church Parade went with Martin & General to inspect sighting of support trenches. Wrote to Doff.

Monday
Entry.193:
Visited Lines of 9th Lancs Fus. met Gen Hill 30th Bde - inspected position with Genl & Mjr Smythe

Tuesday
Entry.194:
Selected site for Day Outposts - Inspected Trenches Visited Outposts by Day Had letter from Doff

Wednesday
Entry.195:
Wrote Doff - visited Trenches Had lunch with Hale and saw Lindeman of 19th.

Thursday
Entry.196:
Visited Day Outposts Supervised training visited night outposts.

Friday
Entry.197:
Went around works Visit from the General Opened the Sergeants Mess. Wrote letters.

Saturday
Entry.198:
Went around lines in morning - sick in afternoon

Sunday
Entry.199:
Feeling a bit off color Heritage & Middleton came over - Had dinner with the General



and Basil - Riding home got lost in Desert reached camp about 1.30 am.

Monday
Entry.200: preparation of work for Courts Martial - Letter from Doff - Outposts shot a camel.
Entry.202: Bn and saw trenches. visited Day outpost - Wrote to Doff
Entry.204: Visit from ADMS & Colonel Millard, A/OC during Martin's absence at Aviation School - Commenced Court Martial on Pte Rodgers of
Entry.208:
and 18th Battns Major Martin returned.

Friday
Entry.209:
Courts Martial 17th and 20th Battns

Saturday 4/3/16 Courts Martial at & 20th Battns.

Sunday 5/3/16 Court Martial at 19th Arnall member of court replaced by Sherbon Boxing match at 19th in afternoon - Orders to move to Moascar on Canal at 10 am 6/3/16

Monday 6/3/16 Left Gundagai Post Sinai Peninsular for Moascar at 11.30 am very warm, arrived

Ferry Post at 5 PM after heavy march

Tuesday
Entry.210:
Left Ferry post for Moascar had a very hard march - dined with Yardley ADC to C. in C.

Wednesday
Entry.211:
Battalion swim at Lake Timsha Courts Martial cases completed sent for luggage at Cooks.

Thursday
Entry.212:
Wrote to Doff. Inspected Coy's.

Friday
Entry.213: Route march Had letters & photos from Doff
Entry.215:
Church parade, Address by Genl Birdwood & afterwards met him Arrangements re musketry

Monday
Entry.216:
Commenced musketry - 100 yds Grouping Practice

Tuesday
Entry.217:
Musketry Practice Rapid fire at 100 & 200 y feeling off color

Wednesday
Entry.218:
Completed musketry course, still sick saw Geo Byrne.

Thursday
Entry.219:
Wrote to Doff all preparation made for move - in charge of 3 Coys of battn

Friday
Entry.220:
entrained 2.35 am arrived Alex at 12.30 embarked on HMT Arcadian sent cable to Doff

Saturday
Entry.221:
Martin O.C. Troops I am in command of Battn - very sick with septic throat

Sunday
Entry.222:
Remained in bed all day very ill.

Monday
Entry.223: Feeling a little better passed Malta & Gozo in distance - still sick
Entry.224:
A little better passed Africa in distance - Had a long talk with General at night over a bottle of wine.

Wednesday
Entry.225:
Wrote to Doff - feeling better arrived at Marseilles at 11 pm

Thursday
Entry.226:
Entrained at Marseilles for Roubaix arrived at Orange at 11.30 pm had hot meal.

Friday
Entry.227:
Crossed Rhone at Lyons & followed valley very pretty feeling off color

Saturday
Entry.228:
Still off color, saw Versailles from the train very pretty

Sunday
Entry.229:
passed throughBoulogne and St Omer and detrained at Troops all billetted very seedy went to bed

Monday
Entry.230:
billetted with a Mon Boulfray all very comfy on sick list

Tuesday
Entry.231:
Remained in all day low fever

Wednesday
Entry.232:
Remained in bed all day, letter from Florrie addressed to England

Thursday
Entry.233:
Quiet day went into Aire for a run in the car

Friday
Entry.234:
Went through gas attack at Morbecque, visit of K 

Saturday
Entry.235:
Martin inspected trenches we are taking over on Saturday next - Battn route march - still off color

Sunday
Entry.236:
Very off color all day - went to Aire and had a hot bath

Monday
Entry.237:
Quiet day conducted Regtl Court martial lettersfrom England

Tuesday
Entry.238:
Three nice letters from Doff quiet day still a little of color

Wednesday
Entry.239:
Went for a 9 mile march with Transport & Travelling Kitchen etc

Thursday
Entry.240:
leaving tomorrow. In the morning Regtl court martial.

Friday
Entry.241:
Left forFront Trenches south of Armentieres marched Outersteene Billet

Saturday
Entry.243:
Went into Trenches Battalion take over tomorrow night wrote to Doff.

Monday
Entry.244:
Came into Trench at Flamergerie Farm took over stores of 26th N. wrote a short note to Doff

Tuesday
Entry.245:
Battalion took over last night things very quiet all day saw the General

Wednesday
Entry.246:
Raining & very cold Germans opposite us about 300 y away Things quiet. Went to Bde Hdqrs

Thursday
Entry.247:
Married 20 months today remained in trenches all day. Shelled by enemy - one on Hdqrs 3 men wounded.

Friday
Entry.248:
Quiet day, raining and very cold, no shelling.

Saturday
Entry.249: Few shells dropped in our lines. One man killed by sniper. Relieved by
Entry.250:
at night one of our men & one of 19th wounded.

Sunday 16/4/16 10 months since leaving Sydney - in Billets out of Firing Line - Number of Aeroplanes of both sides.

Monday
Entry.251:
Went with Bas to Armentieres had a decent lunch & very nice afternoon tea.

Tuesday
Entry.252:
Very cold, Raining, nasty day, wrote to Doff, Mother and several others.

Wednesday
Entry.253:
Had two nice long letters from Doff. Went into Trenches to take over, some shelling.

Thursday
Entry.254:
Fairly quiet day, wet and raining - Received Book from Doff

Friday
Entry.255:
Birthday & Good Friday 200 shells received.

Saturday
Entry.256:
Raining Heavily, Went by car to Berthiem to trench Mortar demonstration

Sunday
Entry.257:
Heavily shelled 800 in 40 minutes 1 officer (Engineer) and 3 men Killed 2 wounded Relieved at night

Monday
Entry.258:
Aircraft active - had a day in Armentieres.

Tuesday
Entry.259:
Heavy bombardment of "C" Coy's billets. All Officers loss kit - 2 men wounded & evacuated

Wednesday
Entry.260:
Wrote to Doff - saw damage to Billet. Went for a bath & tea to Armentieres. Dined with General.

Thursday
Entry.261:
Went into Trenches afterlunch Battalion took over at night Gas alarm much Strafe by our artillery

Friday
Entry.262:
Quiet peaceful day Germans thinking hard after being "strafed"

Saturday
Entry.263: Quiet day generally here handing over a little trench & taking over some on right.
Entry.265: Quiet day a letter from Doff
Entry.266:
Visit fromthe General quiet day generally

Tuesday
Entry.267:
Fairly quiet day relieved by 19th atnight

Wednesday
Entry.268:
Went into Armentieres for afternoon tea, also had a hot bath

Thursday
Entry.269:
Wrote to Doff, had a game of solo. quiet day

Friday
Entry.270:
Court of Inquiry on Kushe Farm Basil's billet (President) German attacks at night, we occupied



Bois Grenier Line.

Saturday
Entry.271:
Court of Inquiry (President) on 2 Stokes Mortars lost in attack on Evening of 5th May by 20th Batttn.

Sunday
Entry.272:
Quiet day, had a game of cards

Monday
Entry.273:
Went to Trenches with Mair- Intelligence Officer

Tuesday
Entry.274:
Court Martial on Lieut Gribben at "A" Battn Trenches - Also more re Stokes Mortar lost

Wednesday
Entry.275:
Quiet day - had a game of bridge with Padre and Smith

Thursday
Entry.276:
Went for a hot bath to Erquingham Wrote to Doff.

Friday
Entry.277:
Took over Trenches from 19th again Had a cable from Doff re directed from Egypt. "Allotment altered February arrears paid. Billie Tooth Love many happy returns"

Saturday
Entry.278:
Went around all the trenches twice, had a nice long letter from Doff.

Sunday
Entry.279:
Quiet day - Left Company shelled no casualties.

Monday
Entry.280:
Quiet day - few shells much work

Tuesday
Entry.281:
Usual day saw the General & had a talk

Wednesday
Entry.282:
Gas alarms (3) Pye shot at night few shells.

Thursday
Entry.283:
Court of Inquiry on death of Pye Saw the General Had a long letter from Doff and a message from Billie.

Friday
Entry.284: Finished court on death of Pye - who had without doubt been shot by our men am sending this with Captain Johnson to post to Doff - he is going on leave tomorrow
